channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Free Mobile désactive massivement son réseau 3G : activez ce réglage pour continuer à passer des appels
item.description: Vous avez trouvé votre 4G un peu plus vive ces derniers jours ? Ou au contraire, votre vieux téléphone ne capte plus rien ? C'est normal. Free Mobile vient de passer la seconde sur l'extinction de la 3G. En un mois, près de 9 000 antennes ont été débranchées.

item.title: Our highest-rated Xbox controller is still available for 20% off, and it's got stick-drift preventing Hall Effect thumbsticks
item.description: The Razer Wolverine V3 Pro is still heavily discounted for the Holiday season. It's got superb build quality, and is our highest rated Xbox controller yet.

item.title: Google Pixel : cette fonction jusque-là exclusive à Samsung arrive enfin
item.description: Exclusive aux appareils Samsung depuis septembre dernier, la fonction de traduction en continu de « Entourer pour Chercher » débarque enfin sur les Google Pixel.

item.title: Le marché de l’électrique d’occasion dévisse : c’est le moment pour acheter une voiture
item.description: La valeur des voitures électriques s'effondre sur le marché de l'occasion. Tandis qu'un modèle électrique de moins de deux ans conserve à peine la moitié de son prix neuf, les hybrides affichent près de 70% de leur valeur initiale. Comment expliquer une telle débâcle pour une technologie censée se démocratiser et intéresser le plus grand nombre ?

item.title: Your Samsung phone's ad nightmare could soon be over thanks to this One UI 8.5 upgrade
item.description: Samsung Galaxy phones might soon be able to automatically block apps that pester you with adverts in your notifications.

item.title: « Régler la dépendance envers la Chine est une priorité absolue » : voici le plan des constructeurs automobile sur la voiture électrique
item.description: Outre les batteries, la Chine a la mainmise sur l’industrie des terres rares, indispensables à la conception des voitures électriques. Et les constructeurs automobiles traditionnels ne veulent plus de cette dépendance, qui leur cause bien des soucis.

item.title: ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Showrunner Wants Your Forgiveness if It’s a Bit Messy
item.description: HBO's newest fantasy series set in George R.R. Martin's Westeros won't have the same polish as 'Game of Thrones' or 'House of the Dragon.'

item.title: Nexus isn’t going all-in on AI, keeping half of its new $700M fund for India startups
item.description: Nexus Venture Partners manages $3.2 billion in capital across its funds and has invested in more than 130 companies over the years.

item.title: Recettes des Fêtes générées par l’IA | Au menu : dinde accompagnée de sa… salmonelle
item.description: Ne laissez pas la bouillie d’intelligence artificielle (IA) gâcher votre souper du réveillon. Car la marée de contenu d’IA qui inonde le web depuis des mois passe à table, en ce temps des Fêtes. Elle menace toutes les recettes, de la dinde du Thanksgiving américain à la non moins traditionnelle tourtière québécoise.

item.title: Ofcom weighs "further action" on VPNs following Online Safety Act
item.description: The agency will continue to "collect information about VPN adoption in the UK" to inform their decision

item.title: The Batman Part II reportedly eyeing Scarlett Johansson for major role – and DC fans think she's a perfect fit for this classic villain
item.description: The Jurassic World actor and Marvel alumnus is believed to be in final negotiations to star opposite Robert Pattinson.

item.title: Philips fait du XXL avec cet écran QD OLED incurvé de 49 pouces avec plus de 200 € de remise
item.description: Avec ce moniteur QD-OLED d’une taille colossale de 49 pouces, vous êtes plongé dans vos jeux préférés : mieux encore, ce dernier qui coûtait au départ 999 euros, il est en promotion à 739 euros.

item.title: La PS5 Slim est de retour à son prix le plus bas chez PcComponentes (et vous devriez en profiter) [Sponso]
item.description: Vous vous dites sûrement que la fin du Black Friday a signé la fin des bons plans. Erreur ! Chez PcComponentes, il y a toujours une bonne affaire à réaliser. Exemple avec notre sélection de consoles de jeux à prix vraiment réduits.

item.title: Score the Ecovacs Deebot X9 Pro Omni robot vacuum and mop for its best-ever price at Amazon — save $600
item.description: As of Dec. 4, the Ecovacs Deebot X9 Pro Omni robot vacuum and mop is discounted at Amazon to $699.99, its lowest-ever price. This is 46% off its list price of $1,299.99.

item.title: Meta AI, l’outil IA de WhatsApp, dans le collimateur des autorités antitrust de l’UE ?
item.description: La Commission européenne serait sur le point d'ouvrir enquête antitrust visant Meta et ses fonctionnalités d'intelligence artificielle déployées depuis mars derniers sur WhatsApp.

item.title: The Garmin vívoactive 5 is over $100 off at Amazon — act fast to save ahead of the holidays
item.description: Get the best Garmin deal at Amazon. Save 38% on the Garmin vívoactive 5 at Amazon.

item.title: A Thousand Blows is back with an uppercut of a Season 2 trailer
item.description: "Peaky Blinders" creator Steven Knight made one of the best British shows of 2025 with "A Thousand Blows", and Season 2 is coming.

item.title: The Dyson Airstrait is at its lowest-ever price at Amazon — save over $150 right now
item.description: Find the best Dyson deal at Amazon. Save 27% on the Dyson Airstrait at Amazon.

item.title: Netflix pourrait racheter HBO Max et faire baisser des formules
item.description: De nouvelles informations suggèrent que le rachat de HBO Max par Netflix pourrait entraîner la mise en place d'une formule groupée entre les services. De quoi alléger le portefeuille des utilisateurs.

item.title: The PC Gaming Show: Most Wanted airs today – here's when you can tune in and what announcements you can expect
item.description: The annual PC Gaming Show: Most Wanted showcase officially returns later today, with plenty of announcements to look forward to.

item.title: Nothing lance un second smartphone en édition ultra limitée le 9 décembre
item.description: Nothing va bientôt dévoiler le Phone (3a) Community Edition. Ce second modèle, co-créé par les fans de la marque, sera présenté officiellement le 9 décembre 2025.

item.title: En 2025, la montre la plus utilisée pour le sport n’est toujours pas une montre de sport
item.description: Strava a publié son bilan annuel. L'occasion d'en apprendre plus sur les appareils les plus utilisés pour enregistrer des activités sportives en 2025.

item.title: Google Drive s’offre une mise à jour majeure grâce à Gemini, mais sous condition
item.description: Google Drive intègre enfin Gemini pour analyser et résumer vos dossiers. Une nouveauté puissante, mais réservée aux comptes payants et un brin indiscrète.

item.title: The Toshiba 55-inch Class C350 Series TV is still at its low Cyber Monday price — save $200 right now
item.description: Get the best TV deal on Amazon. Save 50% on the Toshiba 55-inch Class C350 Series at Amazon.

item.title: Think you know The Simpsons? Test your Springfield knowledge with this superfan quiz
item.description: How well do you know The Simpsons and Springfield? Let's find out with this 30-question quiz.

item.title: UK cybercrime agency blocks nearly 1 billion access attempts to malicious websites
item.description: The Share and Defend service was introduced last year and is defending UK netizens from scammers.

item.title: Quelle drôle d’idée : Apple a supprimé une option photo importante sur ses derniers iPhone
item.description: Pour une raison obscure, Apple a supprimé le mode nuit de l'application photo des iPhone 17 Pro pour la prise de portraits. Cette fonctionnalité permettait pourtant d'aboutir à de bien meilleurs résultats dans les environnements sombres ou en soirée.

item.title: Transformer son iPhone en PC : une faille d’iOS 26 permet enfin le mode bureau façon « DeX »
item.description: Vous vous souvenez de Samsung DeX ? Transformer son téléphone en ordi, le rêve. Sur iPhone, Apple ne le propose pas. Sauf qu'un hacker vient de prouver le contraire. En installant iPadOS sur un iPhone 17 Pro Max, il a débloqué un véritable bureau mobile. Et ça tourne comme une horloge.

item.title: ExpressVPN se réveille et lance deux nouveautés majeures : les utilisateurs de MacBook vont être ravis !
item.description: Début décembre, ExpressVPN lance deux nouveautés majeures et l'une d'elles va plaire aux utilisateurs d'un Mac ou d'un MacBook. Une application native d'ExpressVPN est désormais disponible sur macOS, ainsi qu'une nouvelle fonctionnalité pour profiter d'une connexion optimale aux serveurs VPN.

item.title: La voiture électrique de Xiaomi frappe fort en Chine et fait mieux que tous ses concurrents
item.description: Lancée en 2024, la Xiaomi SU7 arrive en première place au classement de la satisfaction client pour les voitures électriques en Chine. Et ce pour la 2ème année consécutive.

item.title: Fatality : la borne d’arcade rétro Mortal Kombat comprenant 12 jeux est à -130 €, et la nostalgie s’invite pour Noël
item.description: Carrefour fait une promo qui va parler aux gamers nostalgique : la borne d'arcade rétro Mortal Kombat Evolution Edition Midway Legacy est à 379,99 euros au lieu de 509,99 euros.

item.title: Last chance to get Peacock for free this Black Friday — here’s how to stream for free
item.description: Best Black Friday streaming deal in 2025. How to get Peacock Premium for free this Black Friday.

item.description: Connections is a New York Times word game that's all about finding the "common threads between words." How to solve the puzzle.

item.description: Here's the answer for "Wordle" #1628 on December 4 as well as a few hints, tips, and clues to help you solve it yourself.

item.title: Moon phase today: What the moon will look like on December 4
item.description: See the moon phase expected for December 4, 2025 as well as when the next full moon is expected.

item.title: Scientists Are Trying to Fix the Worst Sound in the World: the Dentist’s Drill
item.description: While investigating the dentist drill's anxiety-inducing high-pitched whine, researchers revealed why it's worse for children than adults.

item.title: The Fast Company AI 20 for 2025
item.description: These 20 technologists, entrepreneurs, corporate leaders, and creative thinkers are pushing artificial intelligence in unexpected directions. The biggest story in tech is AI’s increasing capacity to take on tasks once reserved for human beings. But the agents driving that change aren’t machines. They’re humans—inventive, ambitious, enterprising ones. Our third annual roundup of some of the field’s most intriguing players includes scientists and ethicists, CEOs and investors, big-tech veterans and first-time founders. These 20 innovators are tackling challenges from training tomorrow’s AI model...

item.title: Amazon takes on AI’s biggest nightmare: Hallucinations
item.description: Byron Cook, a VP and distinguished scientist at Amazon, is helping the company use an obscure type of AI to minimize artificial intelligence’s worst side effect. And it’s giving Amazon an edge. Up in the Cascade Mountains, 90 miles east of Seattle, a group of high-ranking Amazon engineers gather for a private off-site. They hail from the company’s North America Stores division, and they’re here at this Hyatt resort on a crisp September morning to brainstorm new ways to power Amazon’s retail experiences. Passing the hotel lobby’s IMAX-like mountain views, they filter into windowless meeting roo...

item.title: Figma wants to make working with AI more like working with humans
item.description: Figma AI chief David Kossnick on why the tech industry needs to move past prompting and create experiences that are ‘more visual, more exploratory.’ Over the past decade, Figma has transformed how people within companies collaborate to turn software ideas into polished products. Now the company is itself being transformed by AI. The technology is beginning to show its potential to take on much of the detail work that has required human attention in design, coding, and other domains. But the end game involves far more than typing chatbot-style prompts and waiting for the results....

item.title: The Browser Company’s Tara Feener is advancing search for the AI era
item.description: The recent Atlassian acquisition’s head of engineering on how it aims to build the ultimate AI browser for knowledge workers. You might not spend a lot of time thinking about your web browser, whether it’s Safari, Chrome, or something else. But the decades-old piece of software remains a pretty important canvas for getting things done. That’s why Tara Feener, who spent years developing creative tools with companies such as Adobe, WeTransfer, and Vimeo, decided to join the Browser Company and within two years became head of engineering, overseeing its AI-forward Dia browser. “This is more ambit...

item.title: Nvidia’s Kimberly Powell is applying AI to expedite drug discovery
item.description: The molecular combinations involved in creating new treatments are vast, so Nvidia is customizing its technology to address the challenge. Bringing a new drug to market usually requires a decade-long, multibillion-dollar journey, with a high failure rate in the clinical trial phase. Nvidia’s Kimberly Powell is at the center of a major industry effort to apply AI to the challenge....

item.title: Here’s how Waabi teaches self-driving trucks to navigate safely
item.description: Waabi founder and CEO Raquel Urtasun says the company’s simulators ‘expose the self-driving vehicle’s full stack to many different situations.’ Raquel Urtasun is the founder and CEO of self-driving truck startup Waabi as well as a computer science professor at the University of Toronto. Unlike some competitors, Waabi’s AI technology is designed to drive goods all the way to their destinations, rather than merely to autonomous vehicle hubs near highways....

item.title: Instead of toys or cash, children are wishing for in-game currency under the tree this holiday season
item.description: Much of Roblox’s $3.6 billion revenue in 2024 was made via in-game microtransactions, particularly through purchases of its virtual currency, Robux. As gaming platforms Roblox and Fortnite have exploded in popularity with Gen Alpha, it’s no surprise that more than half of children in the U.S. are putting video games high on their holiday wish lists. ...

item.title: A 25-year study of super-agers found they all have this 1 behavior in common
item.description: Research shows super-agers don’t share a similar diet or lifestyle, but they share one vital trait. You can copy it. Most people say they want to live to a ripe old age. But that isn’t really true. What people really want is to live to a ripe, old age in good mental and physical health. Some of us actually get to live this dream. These folks are known as super-agers and they make it well into their 80s not just in decent physical shape, but also with minds at least as sharp as people 30 years younger....

item.title: Sesame’s Rachel Taylor trains AI assistants to behave
item.description: The former ad biz creative director recently left Microsoft to work on a startup’s talking AI assistants, with more to come. Rachel Taylor began her career as a creative director in the advertising business, a job that gave her plenty of opportunity to micromanage the final product. “I had control of the script,” she remembers. “I could think about the intonation, and I could give the actor notes.”...

item.title: Anthropic’s Kyle Fish is exploring whether AI is conscious
item.description: The Claude creator’s first in-house AI welfare researcher says there’s a 20% chance chatbots are self-aware. What if the chatbots we talk to every day actually felt something? What if the systems writing essays, solving problems, and planning tasks had preferences, or even something resembling suffering? And what will happen if we ignore these possibilities?...

item.title: Justine and Olivia Moore are driving a16z’s investment in cutting-edge AI
item.description: The identical twins parlayed their Stanford startup incubator into AI-focused VC roles at Andreessen Horowitz. Andreessen Horowitz investors (and identical twins) Justine and Olivia Moore have been in venture capital since their undergraduate days at Stanford University, where, in 2015, they cofounded an incubator called Cardinal Ventures to help students pursue business ideas while still in school. Founding it also gave the Moores an entry point into the broader VC industry....

item.title: OpenAI’s Michelle Pokrass is focused on ChatGPT power users
item.description: The most demanding AI fans of today are the median users of tomorrow, says OpenAI’s post-training research lead. Last year, OpenAI decided it had to pay more attention to its power users, the ones with a knack for discovering new uses for AI: doctors, scientists, and coders, along with companies building their own software around OpenAI’s API. And so the company turned to post-training research lead Michelle Pokrass to spin up a team to better understand them....

item.title: Nvidia’s AI healthcare vision spans new drugs, robots, and beyond
item.description: Nvidia isn’t just contributing chips to the effort to transform healthcare, says VP of healthcare Kimberly Powell. It’s building an entire infrastructure system. The healthcare industry faces major challenges in creating new drugs that can improve outcomes in the treatment of all kinds of diseases. New generative AI models could play a major role in breaking through existing barriers, from lab research to successful clinical trials. Eventually, even AI-powered robots could help in the cause. ...

item.title: Why the Browser Company thinks Dia is the best layer for AI
item.description: Head of engineering Tara Feener says the technology is ‘another bucket of Play-Doh’ that can make web browsing better. A few years ago, Tara Feener’s career took an unexpected pivot. She’s spent nearly two decades working on creative tools for companies like Adobe, FiftyThree, WeTransfer, and Vimeo, and was content to keep working in that domain.

item.title: How Google creates the Year in Search
item.description: Simon Rogers, leader of Google Trends, shares how his small team of data wizards parse the ‘world’s biggest publicly available dataset,’ and how organizations use the info to their advantage. We Googled “Labubus.”

item.title: Its time to add AI protections to your will
item.description: With the rise of deepfakes, avatars, and grief bots, AI is now an important part of planning for your death.

item.title: The 3 biggest AI fails of 2025 — Friend, imaginary summer reading lists, and so many hallucinations
item.description: AI failed a lot in 2025, including hallucinations, corporate pilots, and the Friend wearable.

item.title: How to watch Cowboys vs. Lions in the NFL online for free
item.description: How to watch NFL for free. Live stream Cowboys vs. Lions in the NFL 2025 for free from anywhere in the world.

item.description: What's fresh on Netflix, Prime Video, HBO Max, and more the week of Dec. 5, 2025?

item.title: NYT Pips hints, answers for December 4, 2025
item.description: The New York Times' latest game, Pips, brings domino fun to your desktop. How to play Pips as well as hints in case you get stuck.

item.title: Fibre optique : près de 800 nouvelles communes vont perdre leur accès ADSL en janvier prochain
item.description: Une nouvelle étape va être franchie dans la mort annoncée du bon vieux réseau cuivre. Le 27 janvier prochain, c’est près de 800 nouvelles communes qui vont être déconnectées de l’ADSL, forçant des milliers de foyers à adopter la fibre.

item.title: Google teste une nouvelle fonctionnalité contre les arnaques bancaires sur Android
item.description: Google veut lutter contre les arnaques visant vos données bancaires. Pour y arriver, la firme de Mountain View teste une mesure permettant de bloquer le partage d'écran.

item.title: Google asked users for their best Nano Banana Pro prompts – these 3 tips stood out
item.description: Advanced strategies for getting the most out of Nano Banana Pro

item.title: Why ‘job hugging’ can be worse than quitting
item.description: In a low-hire labor market, clinging to a current role—however unsatisfying it is—may seem logical. But there’s a psychological impact to feeling stuck. Amid an uncertain economy—the growth of AI, tariffs, rising costs—companies are pulling back on hiring. As layoffs increase, the labor market cools, and unemployment ticks up, we’re seeing fewer people quitting their jobs. The implication: Many workers will be “job hugging” and sitting tight in their roles through 2026....

item.title: Google’s Project Suncatcher could make the space debris problem a lot worse
item.description: The plan aims to launch an 81-satellite constellation into low Earth orbit. What could go wrong? The rapid expansion of artificial intelligence and cloud services has led to a massive demand for computing power. The surge has strained data infrastructure, which requires lots of electricity to operate. A single, midsize data center here on Earth can consume enough electricity to power about 16,500 homes, with even larger facilities using as much as a small city....

item.title: MédecinDirect piraté : les données médicales des utilisateurs ont été volées
item.description: MédecinDirect, géant français de la téléconsultation, a subi une cyberattaque. Des pirates ont consulté des données personnelles et des informations médicales sensibles. Les informations que vous avez données pendant l’examen médicale ont été compromises...
